content.title: ECMO Vascular Complications
content.definition: Vascular complications associated with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, including limb ischemia, cannula-related injury, bleeding, and thrombosis requiring vascular surgical management.

key_concepts.description: Most common vascular complication of VA-ECMO. Occurs due to arterial obstruction from cannula.
Inadequate antegrade flow through distal perfusion cannula leading to progressive ischemia.
Upper body hypoxemia with lower body hyperoxia in VA-ECMO when cardiac function recovers but lungs remain impaired.

limb_ischemia.incidence: 10-30% without distal perfusion, <10% with adequate DPC
risk_factors: Large arterial cannula relative to vessel size

monitoring.clinical: Hourly pulse check, capillary refill, color, temperature

management.mild: Optimize DPC position, increase DPC flow, reduce vasopressors
management.moderate: Enlarge DPC (exchange for larger), add second DPC

options: Move to axillary cannulation (definitively solves leg ischemia)

distal_perfusion_cannula.sizing: 6-8 Fr antegrade in SFA or posterior tibial artery
distal_perfusion_cannula.flow_targets: Usually 150-400 mL/min, depending on patient size

troubleshooting.low_flow: Check for kinking, reposition, consider larger cannula
troubleshooting.persistent_ischemia: May need second DPC in different vessel

management.local: Pressure, hemostatic agents, suture repair if needed
management.systemic: Transfusion, reduce anticoagulation if safe, factor replacement

management.circuit: Circuit change if significant thrombus burden
management.patient: Anticoagulation adjustment, thrombolysis for critical thrombosis

vascular_injury.aortoiliac_occlusion: Rare but catastrophic - requires immediate intervention

decannulation_complications.bleeding: Manual pressure, surgical repair if needed
decannulation_complications.pseudoaneurysm: Common after percutaneous arterial access - surveillance, repair if expanding

content.statement: ECMO Vascular Complications is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Extracorporeal-Support that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding ECMO Vascular Complications helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of ECMO Vascular Complications include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of ECMO Vascular Complications.

learning_objectives: List vascular complications of ECMO by category
Describe monitoring protocols for limb ischemia detection
Explain management options for ECMO-related limb ischemia
clinical_pearls: Check leg perfusion hourly - ischemia progresses rapidly
If DPC not providing adequate perfusion, consider axillary conversion
All ECMO patients bleed - balance anticoagulation carefully
Harlequin syndrome indicates improving cardiac function but persistent lung failure
